filmography.title: Sing, You Sinners
filmography.role_description: A talented teenage jockey and the youngest brother in a musical family, starring alongside Bing Crosby and Fred MacMurray.
filmography.plot: A gambler struggles to support his family and pins his hopes on his younger brother winning a horse race.

filmography.title: Beau Geste
filmography.role_description: The childhood version of Gary Cooper's character, displaying the charm and leadership that defines the adult protagonist.
filmography.plot: Three brothers join the French Foreign Legion to escape a scandal involving a stolen gem and face a tyrannical sergeant in the desert.

filmography.title: What's Cookin'?
filmography.role_description: A young swing enthusiast who tries to bridge the gap between classical and modern music.
filmography.plot: A group of young swing fans tries to help a classical singer by updating her repertoire.

filmography.title: Private Buckaroo
filmography.role_description: A young entertainer who joins the Army and puts on a show with the Andrews Sisters.
filmography.plot: A bandleader gets drafted into the Army, but tries to keep his band together and entertain the troops.

filmography.title: Mister Big
filmography.role_description: A theatrical school student who wants to stage a modern swing show instead of the classics.
filmography.plot: A drama student tries to convince a wealthy backer to fund his musical comedy instead of a serious play.

filmography.title: Chip Off the Old Block
filmography.role_description: The son of a Navy officer who falls for the daughter of a showgirl, mirroring his father's past.
filmography.plot: A naval officer's son gets into trouble at school and falls for a girl from a theatrical family.

filmography.title: The Merry Monahans
filmography.role_description: The son in a family vaudeville act who helps his father and sister navigate the ups and downs of show business.
filmography.plot: A vaudeville family struggles to stay together and find success on the stage in the early 1900s.

filmography.title: Bowery to Broadway
filmography.role_description: A featured performer delivering a standout song-and-dance number in this ensemble musical.
filmography.plot: Two rival producers from the Bowery rise to success on Broadway over a period of years.

filmography.title: Patrick the Great
filmography.role_description: The talented son of an aging musical comedy star who inadvertently competes with his father for a lead role.
filmography.plot: A musical comedy star is jealous when his son shows potential to become a greater star than he is.

filmography.title: Something in the Wind
filmography.role_description: A musician who helps a female disc jockey (Deanna Durbin) after she is mistaken for a gold digger.
filmography.plot: A wealthy family tries to pay off a female DJ they mistakenly believe was their late patriarch's mistress.

filmography.title: Are You with It?
filmography.role_description: A mathematical genius who leaves the insurance business to join a carnival, finding romance and chaos.
filmography.plot: An insurance actuary misplaces a decimal point, gets fired, and runs away to join a carnival.

filmography.title: Yes Sir, That's My Baby
filmography.role_description: A college student and ex-GI who tries to balance his studies, football, and fatherhood.
filmography.plot: Five war veterans return to college with their wives and children, leading to a battle of the sexes on the football field.

filmography.title: Francis
filmography.role_description: A junior army officer who discovers a talking mule that gives him military intelligence, leading to questions about his sanity.
filmography.plot: During WWII, a junior officer gets help from a talking mule, but ends up in the psychiatric ward when he tells his superiors.

filmography.title: The Milkman
filmography.role_description: The son of a dairy owner who wants to prove his independence by working as a milkman for a rival company.
filmography.plot: The son of a dairy owner takes a job as a milkman to prove he can make it on his own, falling for the boss's daughter.

filmography.title: Double Crossbones
filmography.role_description: A clumsy shop apprentice who accidentally becomes a feared pirate captain.
filmography.plot: A bumbling shop clerk is mistaken for a notorious pirate and must maintain the charade to clear his name.

filmography.title: Francis Goes to the Races
filmography.role_description: Peter Stirling returns with his talking mule to help save a horse ranch and solve a gambling mystery.
filmography.plot: Peter and Francis the Talking Mule get jobs at a racing stable and help a long-shot horse win.

filmography.title: Singin' in the Rain
filmography.role_description: The piano-playing best friend and comic relief who performs the legendary 'Make 'Em Laugh' routine.
filmography.plot: A silent film production company and cast make a difficult transition to sound.

filmography.title: Francis Goes to West Point
filmography.role_description: Peter Stirling enrolls in West Point, with his mule Francis providing unwanted advice and causing chaos.
filmography.plot: Francis helps Peter thwart a sabotage plot at the U.S. Military Academy.

filmography.title: I Love Melvin
filmography.role_description: A lowly magazine photographer's assistant who claims he can get an aspiring actress on the cover.
filmography.plot: A photographer's assistant promises to put a chorus girl on the cover of Look magazine to win her heart.

filmography.title: Call Me Madam
filmography.role_description: A young press attaché who falls for a princess while his boss, the ambassador, handles international diplomacy.
filmography.plot: A boisterous socialite is appointed US Ambassador to a small European duchy, where romance ensues for her and her attaché.

filmography.title: Walking My Baby Back Home
filmography.role_description: An ex-GI who starts a Dixieland jazz band but faces opposition from his family who wants him to play opera.
filmography.plot: An army veteran forms a jazz band and tries to make it big, despite his family's wish for him to be an opera singer.

filmography.title: Francis Joins the WACS
filmography.role_description: A computer error sends Peter Stirling back into the army, but this time to the Women's Army Corps.
filmography.plot: Peter Stirling is recalled to active duty but is assigned to a WAC unit by mistake, with Francis along for the ride.

filmography.title: There's No Business Like Show Business
filmography.role_description: The son of a vaudeville family who falls for a hat-check girl (Marilyn Monroe) and leaves the act.
filmography.plot: The children of a husband-and-wife vaudeville team begin to go their own ways, with one son falling for a rising star.

filmography.title: Francis in the Navy
filmography.role_description: A dual role as the befuddled Peter Stirling and a lookalike sailor, in O'Connor's final Francis film.
filmography.plot: Peter Stirling gets mixed up in the Navy due to a case of mistaken identity, with Francis helping him sort it out.

filmography.title: Anything Goes
filmography.role_description: A showman who teams up with Bing Crosby to smuggle two leading ladies aboard a liner for their Broadway show.
filmography.plot: Two entertainers agree to perform in a Broadway show together but accidentally sign two different leading ladies.

filmography.title: The Buster Keaton Story
filmography.role_description: A dramatic portrayal of the silent film legend, showcasing O'Connor's ability to replicate Keaton's physical comedy.
filmography.plot: A biopic chronicling the rise, fall, and redemption of silent film star Buster Keaton.

filmography.title: Ragtime
filmography.role_description: A small but memorable role as a dance instructor in this sprawling period drama; a late-career return to film.
filmography.plot: A young black pianist becomes embroiled in the lives of an upper-class white family in early 1900s New York City.

filmography.title: Toys
filmography.role_description: The whimsical, dying owner of a toy factory who leaves his business to his military general brother instead of his son.
filmography.plot: When a military general inherits a toy making company and begins making war toys, his employees band together to stop him.

filmography.title: Out to Sea
filmography.role_description: A dance host on a cruise ship who performs alongside Jack Lemmon and Walter Matthau; his final film role.
filmography.plot: Two aging curmudgeons sneak onto a cruise ship as dance hosts to meet rich women.
